Swipe instructions left and right
OK
Steps: %1$d
Finished!
Comlpexity:
Crease line
Valley fold
Fold in this direction
Fold and unfold
Mountain fold
Turn over
Rotate
Blow up
Start with your paper white side up. Fold in half, as shown. The open
Fold the outside corners into the centre line, and crease well.
Fold the top triangle backwards.
Fold the corners of the model in toward the centre, crease well, then open again.
Bring the highlighted corner up and outward using the crease shown. Then bring the highlighted corner back down toward the centre line and flatten.
@string/bird_5
@string/bird_5
Repeat this step on the opposite corner… the model should now look like this.
Fold the outermost corners backwards on the angle shown and crease well.
Mountain fold the model in half. (Fold backwards)
Rotate the model slightly so you can see the bird forming.
Make these creases and unfold.

Using these creases, inside reverse fold to make the head and the tail of the bird. If you have folded the feet at the correct angle (in step 7), the model should stand up. You can refold the feet if you need to.
@string/bird_1
Now Fold the Paper in half diagonally, both ways.
Fold all four corners into the centre and crease well.
@string/butterfly_3
Turn Over and Fold all four corners into the centre again.
@string/butterfly_5
Your creases should look like this. It looks complicated, but don\'t worry!
Fold the outside edges into the centre line.
@string/butterfly_8
Holding each inside edge from the point at the centre, bring these edges out to the points shown.
Then, fold the top edge downwards and flatten.
@string/butterfly_11
Rotate the model, and repeat step 7.
@string/butterfly_13
@string/butterfly_13
Fold the top half backwards and flatten.
Fold down the front outside corners.
Fold these outside corners inward as shown.
Fold the butterfly in half.
Now fold the top layer backwards, at the angle shown.
And now fold the back wing backwards also at the same angle.
@string/butterfly_21
Open out. Your butterfly is complete!.
Start with a square piece of paper, coloured side up. Fold the top corner of the paper down to the bottom corner. Crease and open again. Then fold the paper in half sideways.
Turn the paper over to the white side. Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction.
Using the creases you have made, Bring the top 3 corners of the model down to the bottom corner. Flatten model.
@string/crane_3
@string/crane_3
Fold top triangular flaps into the centre and unfold.
Fold top of model downwards, crease well and unfold.
Open the uppermost flap of the model, bringing it upwards and pressing the sides of the model inwards at the same time. Flatten down, creasing well.
@string/crane_8
@string/crane_8
Turn model over and repeat Steps 4–6 on the other side.
Fold top flaps into the centre.
@string/crane_12
Repeat on other side, so your model looks like this.
Fold both ‘legs’ of model up, crease very well, then unfold.
@string/crane_15
Inside Reverse Fold the “legs” along the creases you just made.
Inside Reverse Fold one side to make a head, then fold down the wings.
@string/crane_18
Start with a square piece of paper, coloured side up. Fold in half in 2 directions.
Turn the paper over to the white side. Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction.
Using the creases you have made, Bring the top 3 corners of the model down to the bottom corner. Flatten model.
@string/dragon_head_3
@string/dragon_head_3
Fold the bottom corner upwards to the top corner.
Fold the uppermost outer corners toward the centre line.
Now Fold the top corner down.
@string/dragon_head_8
Turn model over and repeat steps 4–6 on the other side.
@string/dragon_head_10
@string/dragon_head_10
@string/dragon_head_10
Now the dragon’s head is folded, all you need to do is pop it open!
Open it out by gently pulling it apart from the sides, as shown.
@string/dragon_head_15
Start with a square piece of paper, coloured side up. Fold in half twice as shown to create these creases.
Turn the paper over to the white side. Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction.
Using the creases you have made, Bring the top 3 corners of the model down to the bottom corner. Flatten model.
@string/flapping_bird_3
@string/flapping_bird_3
Fold top triangular flaps into the centre and unfold.
Fold top of model downwards, crease well and unfold.
Open the uppermost flap of the model, bringing it upwards and pressing the sides of the model inwards at the same time. Flatten down, creasing well.
@string/flapping_bird_8
@string/flapping_bird_8
Turn model over and repeat Steps 4–6 on the other side.
@string/flapping_bird_11
Fold “legs” upward along the outside edges, then open again.
@string/flapping_bird_13
@string/flapping_bird_13
Use the creases just made to inside reverse fold these parts.
@string/flapping_bird_16
Inside reverse fold the head, and fold down the wings as shown. Then partially open them up again.
@string/flapping_bird_18
To make the wings flap forward, pull the tail.
Start with a square piece of paper, coloured side up. Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction.
Turn the paper over to the white side. Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction. Your creases should look like this.
Using the creases you have made, Bring the top 3 corners of the model down to the bottom corner. Flatten model.
@string/horse_3
@string/horse_3
Fold upper layer’s outside corners toward centre line, then fold the top downward along the crease shown. Unfold.
Cut only top layer up to the top crease.
Fold the “legs” upwards along the creases shown.
Fold these sections in half, toward the centre.
Fold these sections in half, toward the centre.
Turn model over and repeat steps 4–7 on other side. The model should now look like this.
Rotate model and make creases as shown. Unfold.
Inside Reverse Fold the head and the tail.
To make the horse do a somersault, sharply tap upwards under his tail.
Start with a rectangular sheet of paper, white side up. Fold it in half, and open out again.
Fold both top corners to the opposite edge of the paper. Your creases should look like this.
Where the diagonal creases meet in the middle, fold the paper backwards, crease well and open.
Hold the paper at the sides, bring these points down to the centre line, then flatten. The creases should do most of the work here!
@string/horse_4
Fold the uppermost triangles up to the top point.
Fold sides in to the centre line.
Fold bottom of model upwards so the end sits in the centre of the top diamond.
@string/horse_8
Now fold the same part downwards, in half.
@string/horse_10
Turn over and your frog is finished! To make him jump, press down on his back as shown.
Start with a square piece of paper, white side up. Fold in half.
Fold this triangle in half, crease well then open.
Fold the top 2 corners downwards, but not right to the centre line: leave a little gap.
@string/ladybug_3
Turn model over. Fold down top corner to the centre point of the model.
Now fold this corner upwards, and flatten.
@string/ladybug_6
Start with a square piece of paper, coloured side up. Fold the top corner of the paper down to the bottom corner. Crease and open again. Then fold the paper in half sideways.
Turn the paper over to the white side. Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction.
Using the creases you have made, Bring the top 3 corners of the model down to the bottom corner. Flatten model.
@string/owl_3
@string/owl_3
Fold top triangular flaps into the centre and unfold.
Fold top of model downwards, crease well and unfold.
Open the uppermost flap of the model, bringing it upwards and pressing the sides of the model inwards at the same time. Flatten down, creasing well.
@string/owl_8
@string/owl_8
Turn model over and repeat Steps 4–6 on the other side.
Fold front flap down.
Fold back flap down.
On the top layer, fold the top corners in to the centre line, and repeat on back.
@string/owl_14
Form wing by lifting up from the inside, and twisting the wing forwards. Repeat for other wing.
@string/owl_16
Fold top of model down as shown.
Fold back up along crease shown.
Fold whole top down along crease shown.
Cut ONLY TOP layer, along the line shown.
Fold upwards to form feet.
@string/owl_22
Turn owl over and cut the top layer only as shown.
Turn back over and lift up the ears.
@string/bird_1
Fold the outside corners into the centre line, and crease well.
Fold into the centre once again.
@string/pelican_3
Turn model over and fold bottom corner up to the top corner. Crease very well.
Fold in half.
Rotate model.
Raise the inside triangle upwards slowly, then flatten and crease well.
@string/pelican_9
Inside Reverse Fold the head along the crease shown.
Fold each wing upward as shown, then open out slightly. The pelican will now rest on its wings and sit up.
@string/bird_1
Turn the paper over and fold in half diagonally and in both directions. Crease well and open out once again.
Holding the points shown, bring them both down to the centre point on the bottom line. Flatten model. This is called a waterbomb base.
Holding the points shown, bring them both down to the centre point on the bottom line. Flatten model. This is called a waterbomb base.
Holding the points shown, bring them both down to the centre point on the bottom line. Flatten model. This is called a waterbomb base.
Fold front triangles in to centre line.
Fold front triangles in to centre line.
Fold edges to centre line.
Fold front flaps of top triangles downwards, creasing well.
Fold again, diagonally, then tuck into pockets.
Fold again, diagonally, then tuck into pockets.
Turn over and fold bottom corners in to centre.
Fold front flap to the left.
Crease front flap into toward centre line.
Move top flap to the right.
Move the next flap to the right.
Crease top flap in toward centre line.
Move top flap to the left.
Fold top layers outward along creases shown.
Open out the ears.
Fold nose under to form crease shown. Then fold back again.
To inflate bunny, blow into its nose!
Start with white side up. Fold in half.
Fold to centre line.
Fold in half.
@string/sitting_dog_3
Crease as shown, flatten well, then open.
Using this crease, Outside Reverse fold as shown.
Crease as shown, and open.
Outside Reverse fold once again.
Fold part of neck. Crease well. ‘Sink’ this point by pressing on it to reverse the creases.
@string/sitting_dog_9
To make the nose, crease twice, then Inside Reverse fold each crease.
Inside Reverse fold once again to the end of the nose.
@string/sitting_dog_12
Crease well, twice, along the lines shown. Then Inside Reverse fold both to make the tail.
Fold the bottom part of both sides of the tail upwards toward the body.
Start with a rectangular piece of paper, coloured side up. Fold in half, then open.
Fold in half downwards.
Bring corners in to centre line.
Fold uppermost layer upwards do the same to the back. Crease well.
Pull the sides out and flatten.
Fold front layer up to top, then do the same at the back.
Pull the sides apart and flatten.
Gently pull the top parts of the model outwards, making a boat shape.
Flatten well.
Tuck the little centre triangle under one of the sides. Then bring the outside corners to meet together, letting the sides move outwards.
@string/snapper_10
Finished Snapper. To make it snap, hold as shown and press together. It looks especiallly good with eyes!
@string/bird_1
Fold the top corner down to the bottom corner.
Fold the two top corners down to the points shown.
Fold the uppermost layer of the bottom corner up a little way.
Fold this layer up again, from the top of the triangle as shown.
Add eyes and a nose to the dog’s face. If you like you can even add a tongue!
To make your dog talk, hold the model by the ears and move back and forwards shown by the arrows.
@string/bird_1
Now fold the top corner down to the bottom corner.
Fold the outside corners in to the centre line.
@string/tortoise_3
Fold these same triangles upwards to the top point.
@string/tortoise_5
Fold only the uppermost layers outwards as shown.
@string/tortoise_7
Cut ONLY the top layer up to the centre of the model.
Fold out the bottom flaps as you did in Step 5.
@string/tortoise_10
Fold the 2 sides in to the centre, and the top point downwards as shown.
Now fold up.
@string/tortoise_13
Turn Over, the tortoise is finished!.
Start with your paper color side up. Fold in half, as shown.
Fold in half again, crease and open.
Now fold top of model down past the baseline of the model.
Fold whole model in half.
@string/twirling_bird_4
Rotate model.
Fold down the top flap along this line. Then repeat the same thing on the flap behind.
Now fold the wings back upwards so they sit horizontally, as shown.
@string/twirling_bird_8
To make the Twirling bird fly, throw it like a paper plane. It will tumble in circles!
